content.description: Bolted line on the far Right side of Peanut Rock away from the slab with the other bolted routes.
content.location: Far right side of Peanut Rock. This bolted line sits by itself. Near the 4th class ramp which leads you to the top of Peanut Rock to set up TR Anchors.

content.description: Bolted route on the right side of the Peanut Rock slab that climbs up a water streak lichen smear. Didn't climb the route so not sure of the crux but looked like it could be more slick than the 4 routes  next to this one.
content.location: 5th bolted route from Left to Right on Peanut Rock just to left of a tree at the base of the slab.

content.description: Another bolted line with easy climbing and a few short friction cruxes. Good for beginners.
content.location: From Left to Right this is the 4th bolted route.

content.description: Bolted line in the center of the Peanut Rock Slab. Fairly easy climbing with 2 distinct cruxes, one leaving the ground and the other half way up the route. Good friction practice on this route.
content.location: 3rd bolted route from Left to Right on Peanut Rock

content.description: Beginner route on Peanut Rock. 2nd bolted route on the wall from Left to Right. Mostly easy climbing with a few moderate friction moves.
content.location: From left to right, 2nd Bolted line on Peanut Rock

content.description: Beginner route on the far left side of Peanut Rock.   No real crux. Best moves were off the ground followed by easier climbing.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2 of the upper bolts are missing hangers (12/12) Replaced hangers on bolts 4&6 on 11/24/19. All bolts have hangers again.  Anchor bolts have spinning hangers but nuts are corroded on.
content.location: First bolted line from Left to Right on Peanut Rock.  Furthest left route.

content.description:
This route is located on the arête next to Peanut Rock.  It has two crux at the start and between the third and fourth bolts.  It does not get to much traffic so the route bites back. Get those finger tips ready.   

  I do not know who put this up so my rating can be off a little bit.  All I know is that is very hard.
content.location: Behind Sweet Rock and next to Peanut Rock.

content.description:
This route is actually mixed over half a mile of scrambling climbing with short boulder moves and belly crawling...It has chimneys, tunnels, caves and giant flakes...This was an amazing find...It was stumbled upon just exploring the rocks behind Sweet Rock starting from the SW side heading east over several peaks. The end is spectacular with a 5.6/7 pg13 solo on a giant flake at the summit. During this exploration many variations exist along the way. Basically this might be a good option for the end of the day when you are done roping up. It might sound stupid but trust me its not.  

  Once you do this please comment...Its a very interesting scramble.
content.protection: No Gear!!! just your guide shoes or climbing shoes. Be careful the lichen is a bit sketch.
content.location: Go around the backside of Sweet Rock on the SW right side. Carefully go under the barbed wire and head left. From here you will see a giant easy slab just South East of the small valley with a weird looking bolder in the middle. On the very right side of this slab is a easy looking chimney about 15 feet high, climb this its fun. Once at the top head left and over the rock, you will see TR bolts etc. Then right before you can easily head down and left look right and you will see a giant tree against the rock. Down chimney climb, about 20 feet, the tree to get down...This is awesome and much fun. Once you get down keep trekking East up to the next slabbed face. At the top of this Slab you will see 2 giant boulders head for these with some easy 5.4/5.5 scrambling...Once here you must look down underneath the giant boulder...YES A TUNNEL, just big enough for a human to get through by crawling on your belly, this is hilarious and worth it. From here its an easy interesting descent going behind and right where you will see a small arch...Some short boulder moves will get you down. Now once here you will be in amazement when you will see a Giant cave just to the east. Head to the cave, once you are down looking at the cool giant cave head up left, out of the cave, with some boulder moves all V0. Scramble up the face, some 5.4 moves, looking up at a second cave higher up and left on the face...Once you reach up higher on the slab you will be able to traverse left to a weird looking giant flake, BE CAREFUL HERE...This is where you might want to put on your climbing shoes. Climb the flake which is around 25-30 feet off the ground its 5.6/7 and scary, but worth it. once here head up to the summit.

content.description:
This area is amazing...Still tons of untouched rock here...but there are a few climbs and tons of fun boulders to scramble on and explore. 

  There is a beginners slab with climbs on it to TR looking at the first slab to the east after passing over the barbed wire...These routes are UNKNOWN and are in the 5.4 5.5 range (maybe something harder). Bomber Bolts are located on top of the slab. 

  This area is best for the evening time when the sun is heading over the horizon. Please add beta and climbs if you have done any in this area.
